content.question: All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: The curve begins at point (negative 5 comma negative 4). The curve increases to a maximum at point (negative 3 comma 4). The curve decreases to a minimum point at (negative 1 comma negative 4). The curve increases to a maximum point at (1 comma 4). The curve decreases to a minimum point at (3 comma negative 4). The curve increases and ends at point (5 comma 4). The graph of the function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane. Which of the following functions has the same period as <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
